results.title: Andrea Bocelli: a night in Tuscany [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: David Amphlett, Lana Topham, Insieme SRL and Propaganda Films
results.brief_description: On a warm September night at the Piazza dei Cavalieri in the ancient city of Pisa, Tuscany, the voice that has captured the hearts of millions, Andrea Bocelli, performed as part of a momentous outdoor event in his home town. He was joined on the stage for duets by Nuccia Focile, Sarah Brightman and Zucchero, as they presented an assortment of classical and popular ballads. Songs perfomed include; “Nestle dorma”, “La Donna e mobile”, “Lamento di federico”, “O Soave fanciulla”, “Brindisi”, “Torna a surriento”, “O Sole mio”, “Con te partiro”, “Romanza”, “E Chiove”, “Voglio restare cosi”, “Caruso”, “Misrere”, and “Time to say goodbye”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Amphlett, Lana Topham, Insieme SRL and Propaganda Films

results.title: Andre
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Adam Shapiro, Annette Handley and Kushner-Locke Production
results.brief_description: Andre, an adorable seal is orphaned when his mother is caught in a fishing net. The harbour master, his wife and three children adopt the lovable pup and nurse him back to health. Andre forms a special relationship with seven year-old tomboy Toni and the two prove that true friendship can survive the toughest trials.

results.title: And your mother too! = Y tu mama tambien
results.creator_credit: Alfonso Cuaron, Besame Mucho Picures, Good Machine and Producciones Anhelo
results.brief_description: Alfonso Cuaron shocked and delighted audiences with his third feature, a return to his native Mexico and a return to form. Principally this is the story of two horny teenagers who take a road trip with an older woman in search of a mythical beach. But Cuaron makes his film much more than just “‘American Pie’ in Spanish” (as it is was crudely dubbed in some reviews), creating a clever, funny and provocative work that comments on the irascible nature of teenage friendship and the class delineations of Mexican society whilst retaining scintillating repartee between the leads (Diego Luna and Gael Garcia Bernal riff off each other in a delightfully tangential fashion) and by being downright sexy.

results.title: And what of the future?
results.creator_credit: David Allen, Robert qAlbury and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Investigates some of the social consequences of microelectronics in relation to employment, the work ethic, and the individual’s right to provacy as the amount of computerized information grows.

results.title: And they lived happily ever after
results.creator_credit: Anne Henderson, Irene Angelico, Kathleen Shannon, Len Chatwin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film takes a long, hard look at marriage and motherhood as expressed in the views of a group of young girls and married women. Their opinions cover a wide range. At regular intervals glossy advertisements extolling romance, weddings, babies, flash across the screen, in strong contrast to the words that are being spoken. The film ends on a sobering thought: the solution to dashed expectations could be as simple as growing up before marriage. Award: Dubuque.

results.title: And the band played on
results.creator_credit: Roger Spottiswoode, Midge Sanford, Sarah Pillsbury, Home Box Office and Odyssey
results.brief_description: Based on Randy Shilts best-selling book which was drawn from a true story. The film exposes how the inaction and in-fighting amongst Government officials, blood banks, the scientific community and the general public contributed to the spreading of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome and the general ignorance about the disease. The film will evoke anger and shock, but is ultimately moving. Starring Matthew Modine and an all-star cast of Alan Alda, Phil Collins, Richard Gere, Anjelica Huston, Steve Martin, Ian McKellen and Lily Tomlin.

results.title: An Unremarkable birth
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A growing number of parents are concerned about the impersonal approach to childbirth seen in many hospitals. They find hospital procedures inflexible and more often geared to the needs of the institution than to those of child and parent. Members of the medical profession and parents discuss today’s obstetric methods and alternatives to them. The film candidly records the birth of a baby and the interaction of mother and father.

results.title: An old box
results.creator_credit: Paul Driessen, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated story of a beggar who repairs an old box, in order to set it up and ask for donations. As he stands in the street he gets cold, so he climbs into the box to keep warm. At once a spectacular star descends from the sky to the box and when it returns to the sky, it takes with it the ghost of the beggar. A film without words. (Awards: Chicago; San Franscisco; Melbourne; Dubuque: Los Angeles; Les Menuires.)
